title: Crucial problems in U.S. politics as of 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 16 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Immigration and lowest at Response Environment/ global warming.
The highest Response Immigration has 10.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Environment/ global warming.
min_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 12.0 is found at Response Immigration and the minimum is found at Environment/ global warming where Response is 2.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 16 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Immigration and lowest at Response Environment/ global warming.
The highest Response Immigration has 10.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Environment/ global warming.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Immigration and lowest at Response Environment/ global warming.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Donald Trump.
Response Environment/ global warming has 6.0 times less Share of respondents than Response Immigration which is the highest.
Share of respondents at Response Immigration is 12.0 , second place is Donald Trump at 8.0, and thirdly is Donald Trump at 8.0.
Response Unemployment/ lack of jobs, Distribution of wealth / Inequality, Education/ schools/ affording education, and Foreign policy (general) have the same Share of respondents.
The lowest value 2.0 at Environment/ global warming is almost 2.56 times smaller than the average value 4.69.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 75.0.
